intro: Astragalus effusus, commonly known as the silky milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the Himalayas. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces yellow or greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from June to August. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to thrive in arid and rocky soils. Astragalus effusus is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine and is also used as a forage plant for livestock.
